security: Revealing ERTHYROID/3's identity as a CIA unilateral source would endanger him and cast suspicion on other recruited officers of other liaison services, compelling them to reevaluate their unilateral relationships with the CIA. "The phrase 'a good KUBARK asset,' however, identifies him as a unilateral source of the Managua Station unbeknownst to the Nicaraguan and Mexican Services."
summary: The DO opposes the ARRB's release of the phrase 'a good KUBARK asset' related to ERTHYROID/3, as it would reveal his unilateral relationship with the CIA and endanger him, as well as potentially compromise other assets in liaison services.
summary_one_paragraph: Fredrick C. Wickham, Jr., from the DO, informs the Chief of the Historical Review Group that the DO strongly objects to the ARRB releasing the phrase 'a good KUBARK asset' regarding ERTHYROID/3, a Nicaraguan asset used in Mexico City to interrogate Alvarado during the Samoza regime; the concern is that this phrase would expose ERTHYROID/3 as a unilateral source for the CIA, unbeknownst to Nicaraguan and Mexican services, thus endangering the asset and potentially compromising other recruited officers in liaison services by causing them to reconsider their relationships with the CIA.
title: DO Position on Identification of ERTHYROID/3
